reg:regulation.reg:title:
Corporation of the Village of Montrose
Expropriation Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 41/2016, February 29, 2016]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: municipality means the Corporation of the Village of Montrose;
wells means the two wells outside the municipality that, on the date this regulation is deposited, are used in the water supply system of the municipality.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Expropriation of land for water supply purposes
bcl:section.bcl:text: The municipality may expropriate, in accordance with the Expropriation Act, real property or works outside the municipality or an interest in them, as is necessary for the municipality to do one or more of the following in relation to the wells:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: secure the wells to prevent access by an unauthorized person;
secure the wells to prevent tampering with or damage to the wells or contamination of water in the wells.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authority to enter on and use property
bcl:section.bcl:text: Without limiting section 2 and whether or not the municipality expropriates in accordance with section 2, the municipality may, if it is necessary to do one or more of the things listed in section 2 (a) to (c), exercise its authority under section 32 of the Act in relation to property outside the municipality.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Community Charter, S.B.C. 2003, c. 26, section 281]
